result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore W Hansen III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Complete any and all counseling deemed appropriate.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

Complete any and all applicable costs, surcharges, supervision fees.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment without tax intercept.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore W Hansen III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore W Hansen in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Theodore W Hansen in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Barbara H.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THIRTY (30) MONTHS, with credit for TWO HUNDRED NINETY-TWO (292) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  CONCURRENT TO 13CF3268.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Complete any and all counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, supervision fees and restitution or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court orders a $500.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Theodore W Hansen in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Review hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 9/3/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Theodore W Hansen not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case may be accepted by the drug treatment court.    Effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben in court, defendant Theodore W Hansen not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Daugherty).  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Arraignment scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Defendant Theodore W Hansen in court with attorney Lisa M Schlieben.  Defendant Theodore W Hansen in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
There may be a conflict of interest with the Public Defender's Office.  Case is adjourned for arraignment and status of counsel conference before Branch 26.  Arraignment scheduled for 06-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theodore W Hansen in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Theodore W Hansen in custody.  Antonella Aleman for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ronald P.; Rio P. or Andrew P

Defendant Theodore W Hansen in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Theodore W Hansen in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
